question: A set in Python is an unordered collection of ________ items.
Sets in Python are created using ________ braces or the set() function.
Sets cannot contain ________ items.
To access values in a set, you can use a ________ loop or check if a value exists using the in keyword.
To add a single item to a set, you use the ________ method.
To add multiple items to a set, you use the ________ method.
The ________ method removes a specific item from a set and throws an error if the item doesn't exist.
The ________ method removes a specific item from a set without throwing an error if the item doesn't exist.
To remove a random item from a set, you use the ________ method.
To clear all items from a set, you use the ________ method.
To delete an entire set, you use the ________ keyword.
The union of two sets combines all ________ items from both sets.
The union of two sets can be performed using the ________ operator or the union() method.
The intersection of two sets finds the ________ items between both sets.
The intersection of two sets can be performed using the ________ operator or the intersection() method.
The difference of two sets finds items present in the first set but not in the ________ set.
The difference of two sets can be performed using the ________ operator or the difference() method.
The symmetric difference of two sets finds items not ________ to both sets.
The symmetric difference of two sets can be performed using the ________ operator or the symmetric_difference() method.
The ________ function returns the number of items in a set.
The ________ function returns the largest item in a set.
The ________ function returns the smallest item in a set.
The ________ function adds up all the values in a set.
The ________ function returns a sorted list of set items.
The ________ function returns True if at least one item in the set is truthy.
The ________ function returns True if all items in the set are truthy.
The ________ method returns a shallow copy of the set.
Sets in Python are useful for storing ________ items and performing mathematical operations.
To create a set, you can use ________ braces or the set() function.
Sets cannot contain ________ items because they automatically remove duplicates.
To access values in a set, you can use a ________ loop or check if a value exists using the in keyword.
To add a single item to a set, you use the ________ method.
To add multiple items to a set, you use the ________ method.
The ________ method removes a specific item from a set and throws an error if the item doesn't exist.
The ________ method removes a specific item from a set without throwing an error if the item doesn't exist.
To remove a random item from a set, you use the ________ method.
To clear all items from a set, you use the ________ method.
To delete an entire set, you use the ________ keyword.
The union of two sets combines all ________ items from both sets.
The union of two sets can be performed using the ________ operator or the union() method.
The intersection of two sets finds the ________ items between both sets.
The intersection of two sets can be performed using the ________ operator or the intersection() method.
The difference of two sets finds items present in the first set but not in the ________ set.
The difference of two sets can be performed using the ________ operator or the difference() method.
The symmetric difference of two sets finds items not ________ to both sets.
